fields.description:
In the image creation screen, the user can specify a bucket or create a new one. If they choose to create a new bucket, we should create the bucket right away when they click "create bucket" to ensure the name is unique in the global namespace. 

If not, provide a message in the validation error message style under the widget that states "This bucket name is already in use. Please specify another name."
fields.summary: in image creation, bucket creation should notify user of cloud-wide namespace conflicts

comments.body: normally, the back end does this for us, but yes, we could issue an XHR call immediately to create the bucket.

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1480

This is very basic. It does the check and only shows the user anything if the bucket name exists. It never indicates if the bucket was created or that we're trying. I think it's OK, but worth mentioning.

There is no "create bucket" modal in the system that I know of, but I can create one.

BTW, another option is to remove the "create on enter" option from chosen. That way, there's an explicit create link the user would need to click and that could take the place of a separate modal because it requires an explicit ack by the user.
[~dkavanagh]: The create bucket dialog is in GUI-1622, so feel free to reassign GUI-1721 to me since we don't know when GUI-1622 will be fully implemented.

[~jloza]: I'll take this one to port over what I implemented for creating a bucket in the ELB access logs ticket (GUI-1622) to this one, since GUI-1622 hasn't been merged to master yet.  

The relevant commit for GUI-1622 is at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/f302c6c6961ab31aba1a73dc87de7744c1857629
UX review passed, ready for code review. Thanks, [~kgill]!

[~jloza] I found a case when the error message is something strange, movie attached. I tried naming the bucket ubuntu-precise-2014-06-08, a name that is used in eucalyptus/admin account.

Strangely, I could not reproduce it with other bucket names.
[~alice]: The error when creating a bucket named 'ubuntu-precise-2014-06-08' seems to be a distinct bug (and possibly a Eucalyptus bug).  Could you try that operation via euca2ools?
[~kgill]  S3 operations are not supported by euca2ools. I can try with s3cmd.
[~kgill] you were right, there is a problem on setup #1. I see the same error when using s3cmd. Things work as expected on setup #2. I get a nice error message for all bucket names.
